title: Recall, Robustness, and Lexicographic Evaluation. (arXiv:2302.11370v3 [cs.IR] UPDATED)
abstract: Researchers use recall to evaluate rankings across a variety of retrieval, recommendation, and machine learning tasks. While there is a colloquial interpretation of recall in set-based evaluation, the research community is far from a principled understanding of recall metrics for rankings. The lack of principled understanding of or motivation for recall has resulted in criticism amongst the retrieval community that recall is useful as a measure at all. In this light, we reflect on the measurement of recall in rankings from a formal perspective. Our analysis is composed of three tenets: recall, robustness, and lexicographic evaluation. First, we formally define `recall-orientation' as sensitivity to movement of the bottom-ranked relevant item. Second, we analyze our concept of recall orientation from the perspective of robustness with respect to possible searchers and content providers. translated_title: 召回率、鲁棒性和词典式评估
translated_abstract: 研究人员使用召回率来评估各种检索、推荐和机器学习任务中的排名。尽管在集合评估中有关召回率的俗语解释，但研究社区远未理解排名召回率的原理。对召回率缺乏原理理解或动机导致信息检索社区批评召回率是否有用作为一个指标。在这个背景下，我们从正式的角度反思排名中召回率的测量问题。我们的分析由三个原则组成：召回率、鲁棒性和词典式评估。首先，我们正式定义“召回方向”为敏感于底部排名相关条目移动的度量。其次，我们从可能的搜索者和内容提供者的鲁棒性角度分析了我们的召回方向概念。最后，我们通过开发一个实用的词典式方法来扩展对召回的概念和理论处理。
tldr: 该论文从正式的角度反思了排名中召回率的测量问题，提出召回方向的概念和词典式方法，并分析了其鲁棒性。
en_tdlr: This paper reflects on the measurement problem of recall in rankings from a formal perspective, proposing the concept of recall orientation and lexicographic method, and analyzing their robustness with respect to possible searchers and content providers.
